docTitle.titlePart:
A Content Directory Management Method of Distributed
UPnP Media Servers

byline.docAuthor: C. –C. Chen, Y. –C. Zhuang, and J. –H. Liu

byline.affiliation:
Home Network Technology Center
Industrial Technology Research Institute of Taiwan, ROC

front.div:
Abstract -Universal Plug and Play (UPnP) technology
facilitates the consumer electronic products for
communications where no setup procedures are required
and users can use and control these devices directly as
these devices are connected to the network. Based on UPnP,
UPnP AV (Audio and Visual) technology focuses on
transfer of multimedia content without control point. The
ever-increasing digital multimedia content and a variety of
media servers impose burden on the content access and
complicate the access process. It is inconvenient for users
to access the desired multimedia content via browsing
content directory on each media server. For example, the
users who want to play a video file must find out and
navigate each media server. In this paper, a content
directory management unit (CDMU) has been proposed to
synchronize and manage content information with one
another. A control point can discover an integrated content
directory and browse a rearranged multimedia content list
by querying the master media server's content directory
service (CDS). The system is not failed when the master
media server is out of control or malfunction, the slave
media server will enable CDS by CDMU and replace the
master media server. To be compatible with any other client
media player, the control point architecture is not modified.
front.keyword:
Keywords: UPnP; UPnP AV; control point; media
server; content directory
